intro: Erigeron nevadensis var. sonnei, commonly known as the Sonnenberg fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as meadows and slopes. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish to white flowers. This variety is distinguished by its geographic distribution and subtle morphological differences from other varieties of Erigeron nevadensis.
